meanings.definition: Sorbates: a group of chemical compounds used as preservatives in food and beverages.
meanings.sent1: The sorbates in the juice help keep it fresh for a long time.
meanings.sent2: Food manufacturers often add sorbates to extend the shelf life of products.
meanings.sent3: The sorbates in the cookies were like tiny protectors against spoilage.
meanings.sent4: The sorbates acted as vigilant guards, warding off any harmful bacteria.
meanings.sent5: I imagined the sorbates forming an invisible shield around the food, keeping it safe to eat.

meanings.definition: Sorbates: to absorb or take in moisture or liquid.
meanings.sent1: The paper towel quickly sorbates the spilled water on the table.
meanings.sent2: I watched as the sponge sorbates the soapy water from the sink.
meanings.sent3: The thirsty soil sorbates the rain eagerly, quenching its dryness.
meanings.sent4: Her scarf sorbates the raindrops, leaving her hair dry and untouched.
meanings.sent5: The cotton towel sorbates the spilled milk, leaving the floor clean and dry.
